headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; HONVED REGIMENT NEW-YORK MOUNTED RIFLES. UNITED STATES GUARDS. THE CLINTON RIFLES. RECRUITS WANTED. BRITISH VOLUNTEERS. COL. RAMSEY'S REGIMENT. THE CONTINENTAL GUARD.

docs.lead_paragraph: Miss Dix has called on Dr. LIEBER to send books to Washington for the Germans in the military hospitals. He has requested us to state, that German books, delivered at Messrs. B. WESTERMAN Co's., German booksellers, Broadway, opposite to Messrs. APPLETON Co., "for the soldiers," will be transmitted by him to the proper place, Messrs. ADAMS Co. kindly carrying them free of any charge.

headline.main: The Injustice to Gen. Wool The Craig and Ripley Quarrel The Rebel Congressman, Burnett.

docs.lead_paragraph: I called attention a month ago to the injustice which has been done to Gen. WOOL, one of the ablest and most experienced officers the country has produced. He has been consigned to a life of inactivity at Waterviet Arsenal, while important divisions of the army have been intrusted to the command of politicians, who are unacquainted ...

docs.snippet: The missing canister has been forwarded, and the following are its contents:  The Anglo-Saxon, from Quebec, arrived out 17th. The King of Prussia was fired at at Baden, on the 14th, by a young student from Leipsic, named BROKER, who was arrested. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: The missing canister has been forwarded, and the following are its contents: The Anglo-Saxon, from Quebec, arrived out 17th. The King of Prussia was fired at at Baden, on the 14th, by a young student from Leipsic, named BROKER, who was arrested. The ball slightly grazed the king's neck.

docs.snippet: DR. HOOE'S RESIGNATION ACCEPTED. A meeting of the congregation of the Brick Church (Dr.  SPRING'S) was held Thursday morning, under a call of the Session, for the consideration of the resignation of Dr. HOOE, the Associate Pastor. Dr. KREBS was...
docs.lead_paragraph: DR. HOOE'S RESIGNATION ACCEPTED. A meeting of the congregation of the Brick Church (Dr. SPRING'S) was held Thursday morning, under a call of the Session, for the consideration of the resignation of Dr. HOOE, the Associate Pastor. Dr. KREBS was called to preside, and Mr. SAMUEL MARSH was Secretary."
